Class HadoopTrainPerceptronScalable

extends java.lang.Object

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  HadoopTrainPerceptronScalable.mapOrderThings
      Mapper class of phase 2; gets the category that the feature belongs to
      static class  HadoopTrainPerceptronScalable.mapTrainSmallPerceptrons
      Mapper class of phase 1 See description of runHadoopJob
      static class  HadoopTrainPerceptronScalable.RandomShardsMapper
      Mapper to generate random shards It works pretty simple: We have a counter i, that counts the number of splits that were processed so far.
      static class  HadoopTrainPerceptronScalable.RandomShardsReducer
      Reducer to generate random shards.
      static class  HadoopTrainPerceptronScalable.reduceCalculateThings
      Reducer class of phase 2; calculates l2 norms and average values
      static class  HadoopTrainPerceptronScalable.reduceUnitePerceptrons
      Reducer class of phase 1; Calculates the average perceptron of the Mappers' "small" perceptrons In the end we have one perceptron per category

      • runHadoopJob

        public static void runHadoopJob(java.lang.Integer currentEpoch,
                java.lang.String pathIn,
                java.lang.String pathOut)
                         throws java.lang.Exception
        Parameters:
        currentEpoch - passes the current epoch to hadoop job; important for perceptron training
        pathIn - path containing the corpus files
        pathOut - path to save intermediate results in (must be unique!), epoch and phase information will be appended automatically
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - This class runs two hadoop jobs. The first job trains an average perceptron for each category. The second job calculates the l2 norm and the average value of each of the weight vector's features. After each epoch, the weight vector is saved into the local file system and then is subject of top-k-feature selection.
